description: Made by Hama, assisted by Ranthalos and Meteor w/ technical stuff
name: Basic PvE Weapons rolls to look for

data.description:
I've never really liked the feel of 150 rpm Scout Rifles until this one came along and a good amount of people I've talked to seem to share this sentiment.
Arrowhead Brake will turn your 74 base recoil into 100, which is pretty good value if you happen to get that. Fluted is a good second option though.
With the high base Range of this gun (like 90m), accurized doesn't really offer much so I'd prefer Flared Magwell and possibly Tactical Mag as a second choice.
Rapid Hit to me is one of the (if not the) best perk to have on a Scout Rifle as it gives you so much in terms of Reload Speed and Stability.
Explosive Payload is a generally good damage perk option on a Scout, but since this is a Stasis one it can also roll Headstone if you're into that.
Recommended MW: Handling
data.name: Perses-D

data.description:
For high end content I can't say pellet shotguns have been very desirable for a while and this gun is no exception. Though it does have some fun rolls that you can use in the majority of the game and be just fine. 
For PvE it's kind of hard to go wrong with barrels on a shotgun, although I'd recommended Corkscrew and Barrel Shroud for the benefit of having extra stats, though I wouldn't blame anyone for preferring Full Choke either.
Aggressive Shotguns have a pretty low RPM compared to other shotguns so bumping that feel up slightly with Assault Mag is nice, though I'd also say Accurized Rounds are just as good to bump up that range slightly.
Subsistence is pretty fun on a shotgun as it basically just allows you to run at the enemy and shoot until you're out of reserves if you're doing content that allows you to do so, but Ensemble is nice for group content for that Reload and Handling boost while Lead From Gold is also there if you feel you're lacking on Ammo. (Kind of want to try out Steady Hands tbh).
Vorpal Weapon stands out to me as the best damage option, but Adrenaline Junkie is also a very viable option if you're one to run Grenade builds.
Recommended MW: Range or Handling
data.name: The Comedian

data.description:
If you're a fan of 720 rpm Auto's then the only Solar one currently available in Risen is the Arctic Haze from Europa.
Arrowhead Brake is my go to roll for most Auto Rifles, but Fluted, Hammerforged and Smallbore are also fine options.
Accurized would be my go to as you're already getting a good amount of Reload from Outlaw or Ammo back from Subsistence, but Flared Magwell is not a bad option either.
While it lacks versatile rolls it can still get Subsistence or Outlaw paired with Vorpal Weapon.
Recommended MW: Range
data.name: Arctic Haze

data.description:
A lot of people (including me), are not fans of the Lightweight Bow archetype, but at least this one can roll Vorpal so there's that.
Recommended MW: Draw Time
data.name: Whispering Slab

data.description:
Best legendary Void bow as of Risen, 4th column can roll some interesting stuff like Dragonfly and Successful Warm-up, but I prefer to stick to the old reliable Archer's Tempo + Explosive Head combination. Also this is a craftable weapon so that's a +.
Recommended MW: Draw Time.
data.name: Under Your Skin

data.description:
180s are generally not considered to be in a great spot, but that doesn't mean they don't have some solid rolls going for them.
Hammerforged and Smallbore both provides the stats you're looking for from a barrel.
High-Cal is nice for extra flinch and Light Mag provides a nice boost to both Range and Reload.
Rapid Hit works very well on this archetype as it provides both a good chunk of Stability and Reload, though you can make do with Surplus or Outlaw depending on your preferences and play style.
One For All and Multikill Clip are both good options aimed at different types of activities, with OFA being preferred for activities where you can't proc MKC as often.
Recommended MW: Range
data.name: Survivors Epitaph

data.description: Special Mention: Amazing PvP roll.
data.name: Found Verdict

data.description:
Can roll the old reliable combination of Archer's Tempo + Explosive head in the Kinetic slot as a Precision Bow which makes it a solid choice.
Recommended MW: Draw Time
data.name: Accrued Redemption

data.description:
Hammerforged and Smallbore are both good options.
High-Cal is nice for extra flinch and Armor Piercing rounds gives a dmg buff against shields.
Personally I think Stats For All and One For All is the perk combo you're looking for, but Outlaw and Overflow are also nice options for 3rd column and Rampage is still good for 4th Column.
Recommended MW: Range or Reload
data.name: The Palindrome

data.description:
Personal Recommendation
Hammerforged and Smallbore are both good options.
High-Cal is nice for extra flinch and Armor Piercing rounds gives a dmg buff against shields.
Personally I think Stats For All and One For All is the perk combo you're looking for, but Outlaw and Overflow are also nice options for 3rd column and Rampage is still good for 4th Column.
Recommended MW: Range or Reload
data.name: The Palindrome

data.description:
I'm convinced Arrowhead Brake is amazing on all Auto Rifles with a lower base Recoil of 80, which most of them have and even for the ones above 80 it's a very viable option.
Accurized Rounds is nice to have due to you already getting a good chunk of Reload from your third column perk to push your Range slightly further, but Flared Magwell is never a bad option.
As with 720rpm Auto Rifles I think 600rpm ones also have very good synergy with the Stats For All + One For All combination and this is another one that can roll that. Perpetual Motion is also a good option for those who prefer that and some might prefer the reliability of Vorpal Weapon over One For All.
This weapon can also roll Triple Tap along with Fourth Times the Charm if you want max meme value.
Recommended MW: Range.
data.name: Duty Bound

data.name: Duty Bound

data.description:
I'm convinced Arrowhead Brake is amazing on all Auto Rifles with a lower base Recoil of 80, which most of them have and even for the ones above 80 it's a very viable option.
High-Cal is nice for extra flinch and Light Mag is nice for the combination of extra Range and Reload, though Armor Piercing is also viable if you're using this against Barrier Champions.
For the grenade enthusiasts out there this weapon can roll the Demolitionist and Adrenaline Junkie combination, while others will see the appeal of Subsistence and/or One For All.
Interesting roll might be Demolitionist + Osmosis if you're looking to build craft.
Recommended MW: Range.
data.name: The Last Breath

data.name: Found Verdict (Timelost)
